snippet: Mariano Rivera, 42, tore the anterior cruciate ligament in his right knee while chasing a fly ball during batting practice before the Yankees’ loss to the Royals.
abstract: Kansas City Royals defeat New York Yankees, 4-3; Yankees closer Mariano Rivera injures his right knee while chasing a fly ball during a pregame batting practice; is diagnosed with torn ACL, which almost certainly means Rivera has thrown the last pitch of his season, if not his career.
lead_paragraph: Mariano Rivera, 42, tore the anterior cruciate ligament in his right knee while chasing a fly ball during batting practice before the Yankees’ loss to the Royals.

headline.seo: Yankees’ Mariano Rivera Tears Ligament in Knee
headline.main: Rivera Hurts Knee; Career May Be Over
